title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge orders Shannon O'Brien reinstated as Cannabis Control Commission chair, but state appeal delays reinstatement for a week.
Shannon O’Brien, ousted in 2024 over misconduct claims, was appointed CCC chair in 2022; her term ends August 31, 2027.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg appeals reinstatement ruling; legal fees exceed $970,000, according to The Boston Globe.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police discovered a 38-year-old woman dead at a Newhall Street address in Lynn, Massachusetts, early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been arrested and charged with murder in connection with the woman's death.
The suspect is scheduled to be arraigned Monday in Lynn District Court; names of those involved remain undisclosed.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed satisfaction with the Raiders despite requesting a trade due to contract negotiations.
Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards against the Patriots, calling the game in Foxborough a homecoming.
The Patriots and Raiders have both experienced significant personnel changes, with new coaches and players on both teams.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down in Holden, Massachusetts, disrupting the region with severe thunderstorms.
The National Weather Service planned a damage survey but postponed it to assess the tornado's path and impact.
Fallen trees and power outages affected communities like Paxton and Holyoke, with no reported injuries.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lose 20-13 to Raiders in 2025 season opener, despite first half promise from QB Drake Maye.
New England's defense showed improvement with Harold Landry III recording 2.5 sacks, but still allowed 362 passing yards.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes patience and effort after Patriots fail to capitalize on opportunities, aiming for team improvement.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell struggled in his NFL debut for the Patriots, committing two false start penalties and being involved in two sacks.
Coach Mike Vrabel noted inconsistencies in the Patriots' performance, highlighting the need for improvement across all areas of the team.
Campbell accepted responsibility for his mistakes, emphasizing his need to focus on snap counts and improve blocking skills.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lynn police officer placed on leave after appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop, showing signs of a medical episode.
Video shows the officer not responding, and two colleagues claiming he was affected by a double shift and a bad back.
Police are investigating all potential factors, stressing it seems to be medical; the officer remains on leave amid ongoing inquiry.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders in Mike Vrabel's debut as coach at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks against the Raiders, showcasing strong defensive performance.
Patriots' running backs struggled, accumulating only 60 rushing yards in the game against Las Vegas.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys overcame a rain delay to perform at the Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs on September 6, 2025.
The storm caused an evacuation and delayed the concert, leaving a dedicated crowd to enjoy the remaining bands.
The band played a mix of punk and folk-influenced songs, including live debuts and tributes to the late Shane McGowan.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing a lack of welcome at Patriots facilities.
The ban highlights a strained relationship between Belichick and the Patriots after his departure in 2023.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated they'll find alternative ways to scout UNC players after the ban.
